detailed_profile.position: Partnerships| New Client Acquisition| Business Development| Customer Success| Driving Collaborations for Business Growth
detailed_profile.about: I am a Partnership Specialist with 8+ years in international education, specializing in university collaborations and strategic alliances. I excel in building and managing institutional partnerships, expanding global opportunities for students, and driving impactful collaborations. With a strong background in account management, I ensure long-term success for Universities and educational partners through strategic planning, personalized support, and proactive engagement. Passionate about fostering cross-border education, I strive to create meaningful collaborations that enhance global learning experiences.

experience.title: Partnership Manager UK/Europe
experience.description: -Strategically manage existing Institutional Partnerships (IPs) across the UK and Europe, fostering multi-tiered relationships between GSP market leadership across 20+ source countries and key institutional stakeholders.-Develop and execute end-to-end acquisition strategies for expanding partnerships in the UK and Europe, identifying opportunities for growth and collaboration.-Oversee the agent application submission, appointment, onboarding, and induction processes, ensuring a seamless experience while developing necessary marketing materials.-Serve as the internal subject matter expert for all partnered institutions, proactively monitoring performance, mitigating risks, and acting as an internal advocate.-Effectively articulate and promote the GSP value proposition to current and prospective partners, driving engagement and strategic collaboration.
experience.description_html:
-Strategically manage existing Institutional Partnerships (IPs) across the UK and Europe, fostering multi-tiered relationships between GSP market leadership across 20+ source countries and key institutional stakeholders.
-Develop and execute end-to-end acquisition strategies for expanding partnerships in the UK and Europe, identifying opportunities for growth and collaboration.
-Oversee the agent application submission, appointment, onboarding, and induction processes, ensuring a seamless experience while developing necessary marketing materials.
-Serve as the internal subject matter expert for all partnered institutions, proactively monitoring performance, mitigating risks, and acting as an internal advocate.
-Effectively articulate and promote the GSP value proposition to current and prospective partners, driving engagement and strategic collaboration.

experience.title: Senior Manager- Strategic Partnerships
experience.description: As one of the pioneering members of the strategic partnership team at Upgrad Abroad, I held a direct reporting line to the leadership team, responsible for building and expanding the International University base. Tasked with establishing and nurturing strategic partnerships, my efforts played a pivotal role in positioning Upgrad Abroad as a trusted and sought-after service provider.* Identified potential universities and proactively initiated contact to establish and cultivate strong relationships, thereby creating a demand in the market.* Collaborated closely with the Business Head and leadership team at Upgrad Abroad to devise and execute strategies aimed at enhancing enrolment numbers and capturing a larger market share within target regions such as EMEA (Europe, Middle East, and Africa), APAC (Asia-Pacific), and the United States.* Played a key role in fostering collaboration with educational institutions, ensuring consistent revenue growth through consistent enrolments, and adding value to partnerships. Leveraged my expertise by attending educational fairs, international recruitment events, and planning services to contribute to the success of these partnerships. This included activities such as course mapping, academic articulations, and a deep understanding of higher education landscapes in various regions.* Developed effective approaches to engage with leading universities in EMEA, APAC, and the United States. Successfully built and negotiated academic cooperative agreements while also managing long-term relationships with these institutions.* Actively attended networking events such as agent fairs, student recruitment events, workshops, and webinars to stay updated on industry trends and expand professional connections.

* Identified potential universities and proactively initiated contact to establish and cultivate strong relationships, thereby creating a demand in the market.

* Actively attended networking events such as agent fairs, student recruitment events, workshops, and webinars to stay updated on industry trends and expand professional connections.

detailed_profile.name: Ayushi Tripathi
detailed_profile.position: Senior Legal Associate | 7+ Yrs Cross-Border Experience | Criminal & Corporate Litigation (UAE & India) | Regulatory Compliance & M&A Specialist
detailed_profile.about: ‚ÄúJustice isn't found in the loudest argument, but in the sharpest understanding ‚Äî and it is this precision that defines my practice of law.‚Äù With 7+ years of cross-border legal experience in the UAE and India, I bring proven expertise in litigation management, corporate legal advisory, and regulatory compliance. I‚Äôve represented VVIP clients, NBFCs like DHFL, and global FinTechs in fraud, cybercrime, financial offenses, SARFAESI recoveries, and arbitration enforcement, appearing before courts in Dubai, Delhi, Chandigarh, and Allahabad. My work has led to high-value outcomes, including AED 1M in fraud litigation damages and AED 78K in medical negligence compensation. As Senior Legal Associate at Kaden Boriss & NYK Law Firm (Dubai), I lead junior teams and handle complex criminal and family law cases, securing bail approvals in sensitive narcotics and commercial matters. I‚Äôve overseen M&A agreements, shareholder contracts, due diligence reports, and compliance frameworks tailored to UAE and Indian laws. At Lex Legal (India), I managed DRT/DRAT recoveries, cheque dishonor litigation, and negotiated out-of-court settlements that mitigated reputational risk. My achievements include favorable verdicts in high-stakes civil liability and asset recovery cases, driving litigation strategies that ensured regulatory alignment. I hold a BBA LLB (Hons) from Jaipur School of Law and completed legal internships at VAS Global and the Rajasthan High Court, gaining early exposure to service law and constitutional matters. Strategic, discreet, and outcomes-driven, I offer business-aligned legal solutions that meet evolving regulatory demands and strengthen enterprise-wide legal resilience.

experience.title: Senior Legal Associate
experience.description: Progressed from Legal Associate to Sr. Legal Associate, strategically navigated criminal and family litigation in UAE courts, delivering favorable verdicts and high-value compensations across fraud, personal status, and medical negligence disputes.Achievements:‚Ä¢ Achieved AED 1 million award in a high-stakes fraud litigation and AED 78,000 in medical negligence damages.‚Ä¢ Structured criminal defenses in theft, assault, cybercrime, and drug-related prosecutions under UAE Penal Code.‚Ä¢ Drafted and filed court petitions in criminal and family law matters, ensuring compliance with Dubai court protocol. ‚Ä¢ Provided legal guidance on divorce, custody, and guardianship matters in line with Personal Status Law and Sharia.‚Ä¢ Negotiated directly with prosecutors and authorities, resulting in successful out-of-court settlements.‚Ä¢ Drafted legal notices, complaints, and memos tailored to complex procedural and substantive law issues.
experience.description_html:
Progressed from Legal Associate to Sr. Legal Associate, strategically navigated criminal and family litigation in UAE courts, delivering favorable verdicts and high-value compensations across fraud, personal status, and medical negligence disputes.

Achievements:

• Achieved AED 1 million award in a high-stakes fraud litigation and AED 78,000 in medical negligence damages.
• Structured criminal defenses in theft, assault, cybercrime, and drug-related prosecutions under UAE Penal Code.
• Drafted and filed court petitions in criminal and family law matters, ensuring compliance with Dubai court protocol.
• Provided legal guidance on divorce, custody, and guardianship matters in line with Personal Status Law and Sharia.
• Negotiated directly with prosecutors and authorities, resulting in successful out-of-court settlements.
• Drafted legal notices, complaints, and memos tailored to complex procedural and substantive law issues.

experience.title: Senior Legal associate
experience.description: Engaged in multi-forum litigation, portfolio work for NBFCs, arbitration enforcement, and dispute resolution across High Courts, DRTs, and criminal courts, with deep command over procedural law.Achievements:‚Ä¢ Appeared before High Courts and District Courts across Delhi, Chandigarh, Allahabad, and Nainital in high-value civil and criminal cases.‚Ä¢ Advocated in matters under SARFAESI Act, Section 138, and arbitral award execution securing timely legal remedies.‚Ä¢ Drafted complex pleadings including complaints, petitions, and rejoinders before Patiala House and Tis Hazari Courts. ‚Ä¢ Represented NBFCs such as DHFL in DRT and DRAT, contributing to secured asset recovery through strategic pleadings.‚Ä¢ Facilitated confidential commercial settlements, curbing litigation risk and preserving client interests. ‚Ä¢ Presented interim applications and final arguments in appellate forums seeking injunctive reliefs.
experience.description_html:
Engaged in multi-forum litigation, portfolio work for NBFCs, arbitration enforcement, and dispute resolution across High Courts, DRTs, and criminal courts, with deep command over procedural law.

• Appeared before High Courts and District Courts across Delhi, Chandigarh, Allahabad, and Nainital in high-value civil and criminal cases.
• Advocated in matters under SARFAESI Act, Section 138, and arbitral award execution securing timely legal remedies.
• Drafted complex pleadings including complaints, petitions, and rejoinders before Patiala House and Tis Hazari Courts.
• Represented NBFCs such as DHFL in DRT and DRAT, contributing to secured asset recovery through strategic pleadings.
• Facilitated confidential commercial settlements, curbing litigation risk and preserving client interests.
• Presented interim applications and final arguments in appellate forums seeking injunctive reliefs.

detailed_profile.about: Accomplished banking professional with over 17 years of extensive experience in both retail and investment banking sectors. Possessing a proven track record of delivering exceptional service and driving revenue growth through strategic client engagement and retention strategies. In-depth expertise in understanding clients' financial needs and providing tailored solutions to meet their goals, thereby fostering long-term relationships and ensuring client satisfaction. Proficient in leveraging market trends and financial products knowledge to offer comprehensive advice to clients, optimizing their portfolios and maximizing returns. Demonstrated leadership skills in managing cross-functional teams to deliver top-notch services and achieve business objectives. Cultivating a collaborative work environment and mentoring junior staff to enhance their skills and performance. Exemplary communication and interpersonal skills, facilitating effective communication with clients, stakeholders, and colleagues at all organizational levels. Proven ability to adapt to dynamic market conditions and regulatory changes, ensuring compliance while driving business growth. With a strong blend of retail and investment banking experience, coupled with a focus on Client Relationship Management, I am poised to contribute effectively to any banking institution seeking to enhance its client engagement strategies and drive sustainable growth.

positions.subtitle: ICICI Bank

positions.title: Branch Manager ICICI Bank Bahrain
positions.description_html:
Branch Management: Managing two branches, supervising sales & operations team, and spearheading efforts to drive profitability within the business vertical. Responsible for executing budgeting, strategic planning, and profit and loss management to enhance financial outcomes.

Digitalization:
Head the introduction of local payment services in Bahrain, including the Electronic Fund Transfer System (EFTS) through online banking, branches, and the Benefit Pay app.
Improve money transfer channels to India by working with Sadad, a support service in Bahrain. Connect main systems to let ICICI Bank Bahrain customers send money to India using 900 kiosk machines.

Product Management and Sales:
Handling sales of a diverse product portfolio including Local BHD accounts, USD call accounts, LIC international life insurance, USD investment products, INR mutual funds & services, remittances, direct trading platform, home loans, etc.

Business Expansion:
Secure tie-ups with LIC International and New India Assurance, driving the sale of life insurance and general insurance products in Bahrain.
Implemented a successful initiative introducing a high-yield product, "Loan Against Deposit," significantly enhancing Net Interest Income (NII) earnings.

Team Leadership: Bring together Branch Channel Sales and Operation Teams to develop unified strategies that enhance productivity, improve performance, and increase profitability across various business areas.

experience.title: Bachelor Thesis
experience.description: This work is done to assess the reliability of the measurements using Digital Image Correlation technique.I worked on studying the uncertainties involved in the estimation of material properties in a composite laminate using the Digital Image Correlation technique (DIC). Tests were done to check the feasibility and to find out the uncertainties involved in using the DIC technique. Specifically addressing short term and long term effects of paint to be applied for proper correlation of images on CFRP components. I further worked on validating the results of the DIC technique with the strain gauge technique and finite element analysis using ANSYS. The key work responsibilities were‚Ä¢	assistance in the preparation of coupons.‚Ä¢	Calibration for Digital Image Correlation testing machine.‚Ä¢	Testing coupons.‚Ä¢	Characterisation of the coupons.‚Ä¢	Validating the results and documenting it.‚Ä¢	Development and testing of specimen in ANSYS.
experience.description_html:
This work is done to assess the reliability of the measurements using Digital Image Correlation technique.
I worked on studying the uncertainties involved in the estimation of material properties in a composite laminate using the Digital Image Correlation technique (DIC). Tests were done to check the feasibility and to find out the uncertainties involved in using the DIC technique. Specifically addressing short term and long term effects of paint to be applied for proper correlation of images on CFRP components. I further worked on validating the results of the DIC technique with the strain gauge technique and finite element analysis using ANSYS. The key work responsibilities were
• assistance in the preparation of coupons.
• Calibration for Digital Image Correlation testing machine.
• Testing coupons.
• Characterisation of the coupons.
• Validating the results and documenting it.
• Development and testing of specimen in ANSYS.

projects.title: Design of Autonomous Cleaning Robot
projects.description: Today, the research is concentrated on designing and developing robots to address the challenges of human life in their everyday activities. The cleaning robots are the class of service robots whose demands are increasing exponentially. Nevertheless, the application of cleaning robots is confined to smaller areas such as homes. Not much autonomous cleaning products are commercialized for big areas such as schools, hospitals, malls, etc. In this project, the proof of concept is designed for the autonomous floor-cleaning robot and autonomous board-cleaning robot for schools. A thorough background study is conducted on domestic service robots to understand the technologies involved in these robots. The components of the vacuum cleaner are assembled on the PULU-M robotic platform. The principles of vacuum cleaning technology and airflow equations are employed for the component selection of the vacuum cleaner. As the autonomous board-cleaning robot acts against gravity, a magnetic adhesion is used to adhere the robot to the classroom board. This system uses a belt drive mechanism to manoeuvre. The use of belt drive increases the area of magnetic attraction while the robot is in motion. A semi-systematic approach using patterned path planning techniques for the complete coverage of the working environment is discussed in this project.The outcome of this project depicts a new and conceptual mechanical design of an autonomous floor-cleaning robot and autonomous board cleaning robot. This evidence creates a preliminary design for proof-of-concept for these robots. This proof of concept design is developed from the basic equations of vacuum cleaning technology, airflow and magnetic adhesion. A general overview is discussed for collaborating the two robots. This research provides an extensive initial step to illustrate the development of an autonomous cleaning robot.

projects.title: A study on Uncertainties involved in Estimation of Material properties of a composite laminate using Digital Image Correlation technique
projects.description: Whole field strain measurements as against discrete strain gauge measurements are preferred especially when distribution is required. Prior to using the newly acquired Digital Image Correlation system, this work is done to assess the reliability of the measurements. Several CFRP test coupons are fabricated from UD prepregs and tested.This work is a part of study to assess the feasibility of using DIC system for CFRP components specifically addressing short term and long term effects of paint to be applied for proper correlation of images. This project was carried out at the ‚ÄúStructures Division of Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO)‚Äù, Bangalore, India.

recommendations: Malay Matalia ‚ÄúI recommend Mr. Ram Rastogi for his exceptional contributions as a board member. Babu Nair ‚ÄúI am delighted to recommend Ram Rastogi for his outstanding contributions and expertise in the realm of payments and banking. Ram is a true embodiment of dedication, knowledge sharing, and ecosystem building, which have collectively shaped his formidable brand in the industry. Ram's profound understanding of payments, coupled with his visionary insights into the business of banking, sets him apart as a thought leader of immense caliber. What truly stands out is his ability to articulate complex concepts with simplicity, maintaining a humble demeanor despite being a treasury of insights in the payments and banking domain. Having witnessed his impact not only in India but also globally, I can attest to Ram's exceptional engagements with regulators, bankers, payment companies, and technologists. His mentorship has been instrumental in nurturing several promising fintech ventures, a testament to his commitment to fostering innovation and growth. My journey with Ram commenced during our interactions at NPCI, where his keen observation, exceptional teaching skills, and innate ability to forge valuable connections became evident. Ram's unwavering support and insightful guidance have been invaluable to me, reflecting his role as a dependable friend and an indispensable networker. I wholeheartedly endorse Ram to any organization, whether global or Indian, seeking comprehensive perspectives on the payments and banking landscape. His ability to provide both macro and micro insights makes him an indispensable asset for any consulting assignment in this space. In summary, Ram Rastogi's unparalleled expertise, coupled with his genuine passion for driving positive change, makes him a truly exceptional professional in the field of payments and banking. It is with great confidence that I recommend him for any endeavor seeking excellence and profound understanding in this dynamic industry.‚Äù

projects.title: Unified Payment Interface (UPI)
projects.description: It is an improvised version of IMPS on messaging platform ISO 20020 with various add an facility like Tokenisation ( Virtual Address ) , Pull Transactions , Device Finger Printing as a 3rd Factor of Authenitication , e-mandate and Invoice in a Box.

projects.title: National Unified USSD Platform (NUUP)
projects.description: National Unified USDD Platform (NUUP) :NUUP is another service innovations of NPCI dedicated to the Nation by our Prime Minister , Mr. Narendra Modi on 28th August 2014 , as a common mobile banking platform on USSD channel for offering basic banking services including real time ,24*7 remittance service-IMPS to 75 million+ account holders being opened under ,‚ÄùPrime Minister ‚Äòs Jan Dhan Yojana‚Äù (PMJDY) in the remotest part of the country. This project is envisaged as one of largest Financial Inclusion undertaken in the world. NUUP has eventually established connectivity with all Telcos and have a common USSD short code *99#. All customers of participating banks/PPIs can just dial *99# and get an interactive menu of respective banks/PPIs or common menu depending on the NPCI arrangement with bank/PPIs ) to complete basic banking transactions. Given that USSD alleviates the need for application download and is more secure than SMS , this is set to revolutionise and democratise the mobile based remittance/payments in India and larger sections of the Indian population across the country would benefit from that.

projects.title: Immediate Payment Service (IMPS)-Unleashing Power of One Billion Consumers in India
projects.description: IMPS ( Immediate Payment Service ) is a 24X7, real time, cost effective, channel independent ,ubiquitous payment platform , known to be the best grounded innovation in payment technologies with visionary architecture, facilitating integration and inter-operability between customers of 71 leading banks and 8 telco led mobile wallets -m-Pesa, Airtel Money , m-Rupee and other non-telco led wallets like Oxicash, G Cash, ITZ Cash etc. in India.By bringing Telcos to the IMPS platform, NPCI has created yet another grounded service innovation ‚Äî ‚Äòco-creation‚Äô. This entails the collaborative model that allows large section of unbanked population to reap the benefit of direct benefit transfers in a very cost effective manner.IMPS is getting wide acceptance in India in remittances , merchant payments in semi urban and rural areas where POS terminals are not cost effective and cash management services of corporates too.World‚Äôs largest Financial Inclusion Program ‚ÄìPMJDY - Jan Dhan Yojana of Government of India rides of USSD based B2C payment platform ‚ÄìNUUP of NPCI.In terms of numbers, from one million transactions a month in September 2013, IMPS traversed a long way with a 6 x+ growth in last 12 months , crossing another milestone of 6.50 million transactions last month. Set to touch many other milestones in days to come!

organizations.title: BUSINESS CORRESPONDENT FEDERATION OF INDIA (BCFI)
organizations.description: Business Correspondent Federation of India (BCFI) is an association of 60+ Corporate BC (CBC) members at national level, servicing through over 2 million Customer Service Points (CSPs) in remotest corner of Bharat. BCFI came into being with the intent of promoting responsible finance by the delivery of services to the not so privileged masses through the critical last mile route.Over past two years, while continuing to serve bank customers, CSPs were exposed to huge risk of pandemic. Despite this risk, in these difficult times, the services in last miles have continued unhindered and the BCs have been recognized by Department of Financial Services as COVID Warriors. Governor RBI and Finance Minister made positive announcements in media about the role of BCs in such difficult times.BCFI is a not-for-profit organisation . Advisor to the Board of BCFI is an honorary position. https://bcfi.org.in/

organizations.title: Fintech Association for Consumer Empowerment
organizations.description: FinTech Association for Consumer Empowerment (FACE) is a not-for-profit organisation to voice the common concerns of Consumer Lending FinTech companies with regulators, media, listing or distribution platforms (like Google Play Store) and other external stakeholders.The association, which got registered in September 2020, comprises of industry leaders in the FinTech Lending space, and looks to be the bridge between the lending entities & consumers on one hand, and banks/NBFCs, regulatory bodies, government, media houses & listing platforms on the other. The members of FACE comprise of the founders of the leading Indian digital lending platforms KreditBee, EarlySalary, Kissht, CashE, and LoanTap.Chairman -Governance Council at FACE is an honorary position.
